intro: Ranunculus szurulensis, commonly known as the Szurulény ranunculus, is a species of flowering plant native to Hungary. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes a variety of herbaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. This species is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
